name: Park Vista - DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel - Gatlinburg

reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Vista for a total of 7 nights. The rooms were SO clean and nice! We were in room 1002. It was a city view and we were higher than the Space Needle. It was beautiful! The bathroom was clean and there were plenty of towels. The thermostat was easy to control and we never got hot! It cooled the room amazingly!
reviews.title: Clean Rooms, Amazing Pools, & a Beautiful View!

reviews.text: The pools were amazing, and there were always plenty of clean, warm towels when it closed.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: To use the internet there was a fee but there were computers in the lobby to use. We have AT&T on our cell phones and that gave us free wifi on our iPhones, that was a nice surprise so we didn't have to use a lot of our data plan.
reviews.title: Unsolved mystery
Nice view around
reviews.text: Also my daughter loves the cookies! I can not say enough wonderful things!

One of the best things, for $2 a day you can buy a trolley pass at the front desk and go anywhere in Gatlinburg! That sure beats paying .50 cents every time you get on the trolley! I will definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Clean Comfortable
Location is lovey, hotel in need of renovation
reviews.text: The hotel is in a BEAUTIFUL location, get a mountain view with a balcony, it is lovely. However, the rooms are old and tired. No executive lounge for Hilton gold and diamond members. Only gave one breakfast coupon per day, when there was 2 of us (HH benefit is 2). When I asked the front desk if there was an executive lounge I was told "I don't think so". Woke up at 4AM one morning very thirsty, went to the front desk to see if I could get a water and was told to go to a vending machine.

reviews.title: Just the right distance from Gatlinburg
reviews.text: If you are in Gatlinburg for something other than the tourist attractions on the main drag, this is an excellent location with beautiful views and outdoor spaces. While you may not be able to walk to town from the hotel parking lot, you are close to back roads that will take you to parking without having to spend too much time dealing with the traffic on Parkway. The views are spectacular. The pool area is excellent for all ages, and great fun for the children. The hotel backs up to a National Park motor trail that has many points of interest and walking trails of varying difficulty.

reviews.title: Housekeeping Controlls This Hotel
reviews.text: After driving 3 hours, we were tired and really wanted to get in our room and relax. I knew we were arriving early for the 4PM check-in (it was 1PM) but decided to ask at the desk anyway. The woman was very nice and called housekeeping to check for cleaned rooms - there was only one room available on the 1st floor, which we declined (we wanted a "view" room). Instead we opted to go to the lobby restaurant, have lunch and kill a little time. We loved their lunch selections - spent about 1 1/2 hours chatting with the staff and eating, then went back to the front desk to ask about our room. Unfortunately we weren't able to add our lunch bill to our room because we hadn't checked in yet. It was around 2:30 when we went back to the desk and they still had NO rooms to offer us. So the lady at the desk put a "block" on a specific room for us and told housekeeping (for the 2nd time) that we were patiently waiting in the lobby. This routine went on every hour until exactly 4:05PM when our room was magically "clean" and ready for occupancy. We are Hilton Honor's Members and travel quite often - many times arriving earlier than the posted check-in time. I can't ever remember waiting in a lobby for 3 hours while they cleaned a room - and the housekeeping staff knew we were waiting!!. Once in the room, we noticed that the ice bucket lid was missing. We called 2 times to request the lid and still never received it by the time we checked out. Also, I could write my name in the dust on top of the desk and there was way too much mold on the grout in the tub (how long did it take them to "clean" this room??). When I noticed that I had no "service" on my cell phone, I asked the staff where I could find the pay phone. They have no pay phone, so they offered me their desk phone if my call was local. Since I was calling out of the area, we had to ride the trolley into town, just to make our call. Our whole stay was just one inconvenience after another. I wouldn't recommend this hotel until they have revamped their housekeeping staff and gain control of their hotel.

reviews.title: Just okay overall... Service was mediocre at best
reviews.text: I know there are a lot of very positive reviews for this hotel and there are many positives. The rooms are a little worn but nice and the view is beautiful but that is about the best we can say. It started with check in which was a fiasco.... Check in was at 4pm but by the time we were able to get a room it was about 5:30pm and the room we originally had was swapped to someone else who did not like their first room. So that was the room we got. The wait was because they were"refreshing" it making sure it was "perfect" per the manager. Well it wreaked with bleach smell covering up an offensive odor that was bleeding through if you know what I mean.... Then there was the coffee maker that malfunctioned which literally left my wife's tongue black for most of a day. Reported to the front desk they were going to replace the coffee maker which do not believe ever happened... Then at the pool no towels despite calls to the front desk my multiple guests over the course of nearly an hour. Had to get 2 hand towels from the gym to dry my 5 year old and leave so not sure when they arrived. The shuttle was a little sporadic and slow. There is a $5 come and go all day parking near the convention center on Historic Nature Airport Road (or something like that). Overall the hotel was fine, just disappointed in the service and management. Also, if you book through a third party such as Expedia, Hotel.com etc...I would be careful as this location originally had problems with the reservation when we booked and another guest had an issue asking them to double pay due to the records after they had paid in full. I am a Hilton Honors member and generally like Hilton properties but we will pass on this one in the future.

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.text: We were in Gatlinburg and stayed 2 nights at Park Vista. The room was great, the pools were awesome and the view was specatular! This will be our go to hotel for the Gatlinburg area from now on! We loved our stay! The warm cookie they hand you at check in added a little touch of home to the visit too.

This was our first visit to Gatlinburg. This hotel has spectacular views of the mountains and a quiet serene location. Our room was clean and comfortable with an awesome view of the Smokies via a standing balcony!! The indoor pool area looked great for kids and room service was very good! The only negative I could see was the gift shop area. The "gift shop" is a room behind the check in desk that does not have a cashier, you have to take your purchases to the check in desk to pay. Both times we tried to do this there was a very long line as only one person was working at the desk, it was fine for us but I did hear many people becoming frustrated in line.The hotel is not really in walking distance to the town as it is up a very steep hill, however there is trolley to transport you there. We didn't utilize the trolley, we decided to drive instead and we were in the town within minutes. I have to say as we were walking through the town, this hotel looked to be the nicest. We appreciated the beautiful quiet location and clean rooms. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. This was truly a wonderful place to stay and if we ever make our way to the Smokies again, we will definitely choose this hotel!!
reviews.title: Weekend in the Smokies!!

reviews.text: This was our first experience in Gatlinburg and we picked "The Best" place to stay. After hours of searching we chose PV. The staff was extremely tentative to our needs and the hospitality was top notch. I know superior service when I see it (I work at a resort in Florida). As soon as we left we had planned our next trip back. PV was full, but you would never know. Great place for families with children of all ages. The indoor pool area was great for the kids. Our view overlooked the mountains (parking lot side). As you drive up to the hotel the road splits ...left to the hotel and the road to the right takes you on the best scenic drive that you can experience by car. There are also several trail heads for hiking. Very quiet and restful. Do yourself a favor and stay here...you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Heaven in Gatlinburg

reviews.text: The pool is great for kids. The quality of the meeting rooms was good, as well as good service during catering, etc. Great views all around the hotel. Pros: awesome views, good service, very family oriented Cons: Could have used more staff, and a better fitness center
reviews.title: Overall great experience

reviews.text: We stay at this hotel often! It is a great weekend get away for us and overlooks the city of Gatlinburg and the Ober Gatlinburg Ski Slopes. It has lots of amenities and is newly updated. The pool area is like none other, beautiful waterfalls, pools and sitting area. I would suggest this one as a great place to enjoy the area and views of the Great Smoky Mountains.
reviews.title: Stay often, Great Everytime!

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Beautiful view.

reviews.text: My group and I really enjoyed our stay here at this hotel! The only thing I would say that needed improvement were the check-in procedures. I stood in line for a number of minutes while one person was trying desperately to check others in. Nevertheless, everything else met my expectations. Our rooms were on the 12th floor and provided an excellent view of the high mountains. Also, the waterpark was great for a nice evening swim. Cindy, who worked the lounge area, provided great service and chat during our visit. And finally, the hotel's location sets on top of a high hill AWAY from the downtown area! You are only a couple of minutes from the downtown area but yet so far! I hope to return here on my next vacation to Gatlinburg.
reviews.title: The Park Vista Stay

reviews.text: Great location. Bordering the National Park. Excellent view overlooking the town (I was on the 12th floor). Private balcony. This hotel is about 1 mile from downtown. The trolley picks you up at the front door and takes you on various routes. Enjoy the sites and sounds of downtown without having to find and pay for parking!
reviews.title: Great Location
So-So
reviews.text: This hotel was just ok. I thought the front desk counter could have used more employees checking guests in. Only one person training another while a line of guests waiting. Bathroom in our room smelled musty as if the shower curtain needed washed. Had to request an additional comforter because of stains on it. After that I was questioning the cleanliness. The entry door to the pool w disgusting with smudges and fingerprints that had been there for our entire 3-day stay along with a dirty wine glass sitting next to the stairs the the entire time of our stay. The wait staff could also be more friendlier.

reviews.title: Park Vista Hotel Review
reviews.text: Hotel was nice looking on the top of a steep climb. Check-in was okay. The person checking us in was dealing with a possible mistake she might of made on the previous check-in and was not focused on our check-in. We did not get cookies when we checked in. The pool was nice and my daughter enjoyed the slide. The fitness facility met my needs as well. The room was quiet except for the last night of our stay, when we could hear our loud neighbors. The room was clean and room service did a good job. Overall we had a nice stay at this hotel.

reviews.title: Large, older convention hotel away from the noise of Gatlinburg
reviews.text: Good mountain views. No valet parking with minimal parking spaces close to the hotel entrance. Less than clean common areas. Large rooms with useless balconies. Very, very small bathroom, one sink, old tub and toilet up against themselves. No safe and tiny closet. Noisy window type air conditioner. Warn out bed with nice bed linens. Room was clean. Elevators sounded like freight elevators. Not walking distance to town with pay shuttle running every half hour.

description: The Park Vista a DoubleTree by Hilton Gatlinburg hotel is known for its spectacular views and exquisite service. Overlooking the beautiful Smoky Mountains National Park and the quaint city of Gatlinburg, each guestroom has its own private balcony with amazing views. Conveniently located on the City’s Trolley Route, The Park Vista is only minutes from the many restaurants, shops and attractions that downtown Gatlinburg has to offer. And if your adventures include a visit to Dollywood Theme Park or a day of Outlet Shopping we are only minutes away! All guestrooms include a 42” flat screen television, refrigerator and wireless high-speed internet access. Other hotel amenities include:• In-room Dining• Business Center • Complimentary Wireless HISA in public areas• Spectacular Indoor Pool / Water Park• Outdoor Playground & Arcade• State-of-the-art Fitness CenterEnjoy your favorite beverages and appetizers, expertly created and served in our own Firefly’s Patio Lounge. Or relax and enjoy an enticing menu of freshly prepared Southern-inspired selections at The Vista Grill, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner daily. With just over 25,000 square feet of flexible meeting and banquet space as well as an executive boardroom, our professional catering and convention services team will insure a flawless and memorable experience for your next sales meeting, seminar, luncheon or social event. Whether your next visit to Gatlinburg involves a meeting, leisure or both, our friendly staff will always welcome you to The Park Vista a DoubleTree by Hilton with our signature, warm DoubleTree chocolate chip cookie and true southern hospitality.
